1.text: Every wise woman builds her house: but the foolish plucks it down with her hands.

2.text: He that walks in his uprightness fears the LORD: but he that is perverse in his ways despises him.

3.text: In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride: but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.

4.text: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean: but much increase is by the strength of the ox.

5.text: A faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness will utter lies.

6.text: A scorner seeks wisdom, and finds it not: but knowledge is easy to him that understands.

7.text: Go from the presence of a foolish man, when you perceive not in him the lips of knowledge.

8.text: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way: but the folly of fools is deceit.

9.text: Fools make a mock at sin: but among the righteous there is favor.

10.text: The heart knows his own bitterness; and a stranger does not intermeddle with his joy.

11.text: The house of the wicked shall be overthrown: but the tabernacle of the upright shall flourish.

12.text: There is a way which seems right to a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.

13.text: Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that mirth is heaviness.

14.text: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man shall be satisfied from himself.

15.text: The simple believes every word: but the prudent man looks well to his going.

16.text: A wise man fears, and departs from evil: but the fool rages, and is confident.

17.text: He that is soon angry deals foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.

18.text: The simple inherit folly: but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.

19.text: The evil bow before the good; and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.

20.text: The poor is hated even of his own neighbor: but the rich has many friends.

21.text: He that despises his neighbor sins: but he that has mercy on the poor, happy is he.

22.text: Do they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.

23.text: In all labor there is profit: but the talk of the lips tends only to penury.

24.text: The crown of the wise is their riches: but the foolishness of fools is folly.

25.text: A true witness delivers souls: but a deceitful witness speaks lies.

26.text: In the fear of the LORD is strong confidence: and his children shall have a place of refuge.

27.text: The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

28.text: In the multitude of people is the king’s honor: but in the want of people is the destruction of the prince.

29.text: He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding: but he that is hasty of spirit exalts folly.

30.text: A sound heart is the life of the flesh: but envy the rottenness of the bones.

31.text: He that oppresses the poor reproaches his Maker: but he that honors him has mercy on the poor.

32.text: The wicked is driven away in his wickedness: but the righteous has hope in his death.

33.text: Wisdom rests in the heart of him that has understanding: but that which is in the middle of fools is made known.

34.text: Righteousness exalts a nation: but sin is a reproach to any people.

35.text: The king’s favor is toward a wise servant: but his wrath is against him that causes shame.
